question: Who used these reasons as an explanation as to why the colonies must declare their independence from Britain? (People are born with... unalienable rights / If a government abuses... create a new government / Vow to defend...)
On June 7, 1776 ___ of Virginia introduced a key resolution to Congress that called the colonies "free and independent states"...

___ was rung to announce the first reading of the Declaration of Independence, in Philadelphia on July 8, 1776.
How many states had to ratify the Bill of Rights for them to take effect?
When did the Bill of Rights become part of the Constitution?
In which 1803 case did the Supreme Court rule that it had the power to abolish laws by declaring them unconstitutional?
What effect did these weaknesses have on the ability of the national government to function? (Regarding "Weaknesses of the Articles of Confederation")
option_a: Other countries were eager to make alliances
option_b: Made trading with other countries easier
option_c: Weak at home and powerless in dealings with other countries
correct_answer: Weak at home and powerless in dealings with other countries

question: Who became the leader of the 1780s movement that demanded lower taxes and the closing of courts that punished debtors?
Why can the Northwest Ordinance be considered a successful action by Congress under the Articles of Confederation?
option_b: Policy under which the government backs every dollar with gold
option_c: It provided a workable plan for converting new territories into states
option_d: A movement aimed at improving the lives of the poor
correct_answer: It provided a workable plan for converting new territories into states

question: Who is credited with this quote? "The eyes of the United States are turned upon this assembly..."
What was the Three-Fifths Compromise?
option_a: Plan to have two houses of Congress
option_b: The plan for how enslaved people were to be counted for taxation and population
option_c: Policy of U.S. opposition to any European interference
option_d: How the transcontinental railroad was to be funded
correct_answer: The plan for how enslaved people were to be counted for taxation and population

question: Framers were concerned that too much power might fall into the hands of a single group. To avoid this problem, what division of duties system did the Framers turn?
How can a person under the age of 18 be a good citizen?
option_c: Writing to your elected officials about issues that concern you
correct_answer: Writing to your elected officials about issues that concern you

question: Who is this national political leader? (Image of Kamala Harris)
___ is the U. S. Attorney General.
What document asked the King to restore harmony between Britain and the colonies?
Who are Mercenaries?
option_a: Professional soldier hired to fight for a foreign country
option_d: A person who buys huge areas of land for a low price
correct_answer: Professional soldier hired to fight for a foreign country

question: How were the concerns of the colonies answered by the King of England?
option_b: Repeated petitions have been answered only by repeated injury
correct_answer: Repeated petitions have been answered only by repeated injury

question: What is the Preamble to the United States Constitution?
option_a: First formal proposal to unite the American colonies
option_b: Compromise that might have prevented secession
option_c: A brief introductory statement of the Constitution's fundamental purposes
option_d: A written statement issued by a grand jury
correct_answer: A brief introductory statement of the Constitution's fundamental purposes

question: Who has used the Preamble as reliable evidence of the Founding Father's intentions?
What is an example of how this nation has been able to "provide for the common defense"?
Which Amendment to the Constitution guarantees people this right? (Image of soldiers with muskets)

How did Taiwan prepare its people for democracy?
option_a: Began by electing village, county and city governments
option_c: Allowed leaders to ascend to office through heredity
correct_answer: Began by electing village, county and city governments

question: Where do our laws, family structure, political opinions and courts have their roots?
What philosopher believed that government should serve people and protect them and their freedom?
How are rights different from responsibilities?
option_d: Rights are protections guaranteed to you. Responsibilities are duties you owe
correct_answer: Rights are protections guaranteed to you. Responsibilities are duties you owe

question: What is a reason for the success of the U.S. Constitution?
option_b: Lack of a Bill of Rights
option_c: It can be changed, when necessary, to meet the changing needs
correct_answer: It can be changed, when necessary, to meet the changing needs

question: Where were these leaders instrumental in bringing democracy? (Indira Gandhi, Mohandas Gandhi, Jawaharial Nehru)
What was once called the Hidden Holy Land because of its isolation?
Who started most of the famous universities of Europe?
What is deforestation?
option_a: Method in which the land is left unplanted
option_b: Process of moving water and wind across the earth's surface
option_c: Strips of land cut out of a hillside like stair steps

question: Why is Luxembourg so attractive to foreign countries?

Who was the first woman elected to statewide office in Texas?

Who was appointed to serve Texas as its current Secretary of State?
The Virginia House of Burgesses was the first ___ in the British colonies.
The individuals that signed the Mayflower Compact were all ___.

option_a: It was the fastest way back to Europe
option_b: It was the direction of Canada
option_c: It was most likely to lead to the other sea
option_d: It was where the older colonies were located
correct_answer: It was most likely to lead to the other sea

question: Limited governments feature all of the following characteristics EXCEPT ___.
India's economy features a large population. This allows the economy to provide ___ for service industries from around the world.
In an unlimited government, ___ and there are no limits on a ruler's authority.
option_a: laws only apply to authority figures
option_c: laws are decided by the people
option_d: laws are used to control the people
correct_answer: laws are used to control the people

question: The Speaker of the United States House of Representative is ___.
The Spanish government was a ___ when Texas was a colony.
Most of the British colonies were ___ with members of the community elected to make laws.
option_d: run by a board of directors

question: The Jamestown colony was established in ___.
Currently, ___ serves as the Vice President of the United States.
Examples of cash crops in the southern colonies include ___.
A(n) ___ best helps advanced economies develop technology and continue to advance.
John Smith was a leader of ___ that helped them survive the harsh winters they faced after starting their settlement.
In societies with representative governments, there are three main categories of rights that are protected: personal rights, political rights, and ___.
The economic traditions of ___ influenced the colonists in North America to develop a free enterprise system for their economy.
The U.S. economic system features significantly less ___ than a communist system.
An agricultural product that is farmed for its value for sale rather than its use to the farmer is known as ___.
March 2, 1836 is celebrated in the state of Texas because it is when ___.
option_a: Texas defeated Mexican troops at Goliad
option_b: Texas was admitted into the United States

question: The British began colonizing the east coast of North America partially to compete with the colonies already started by the Spanish and ___.
The land area that was authorized as a colony by The Charter of Massachusetts Bay was located between the Merrimack and the ___ Rivers.
The ___ was a conflict that took place in the North American colonies of France and Britain from 1754 to 1763.
According to The Instructions for the Virginia Colony, ___ were not to be allowed to be between the settlement and the sea coast.
The Mayflower Compact was signed on November 11, ___.

All of the above describe ___. (First person to write detailed accounts about Texas, Explored for Spain, Survived Narváez expedition)
Under the free enterprise system in the United States, key economic questions are answered by ___.
The Instructions for the Virginia Colony warned against settling too close to the mouth of a river because ___.
option_a: there would be more flooding and rain
option_b: crops would not grow in the marshy areas
option_c: an enemy could have success attacking
option_d: Natives were likely to already live there
correct_answer: an enemy could have success attacking

question: The excerpt above from The Mayflower Compact was signed by subjects of ___ the monarch of Great Britain.
A ___ government is based on the belief that power is held by the people and their concerns should be addressed by elected officials.
The Charter of Massachusetts Bay created a colony in the area known at the time as ___.

The United States and Canada have very developed economies and are highly industrialized. Immigration is important in these countries to provide ___.
French explorers in Texas were motivated by the desire to start a colony that would give them access to ___.
The characteristic of the U.S. system of free enterprise that most helps produce better products and lower prices is ___.
All of the following are examples of civic participation EXCEPT for ___.
___ is the active involvement of individuals at the local, state, and national levels of government.
Some British colonists were active in ___ that generally featured small-scale production of goods at home.
___ is the current President of the United States.
The economic theory of ___ stated that a nation's wealth is created by beneficial trade based on exploiting the resources of its colonies.

The city of New Orleans was founded by the ___ in 1718 and became a major port at the mouth of the Mississippi River.
The Trans-Atlantic slave trade enslaved Africans and forced them to migrate mainly to ___.

All of the items listed above are examples of ___ governments. (List includes: Theocracy, Oligarchy, Absolute Monarchy)
Taking care of yourself and accepting responsibility for your actions are examples of ___.
The ___ was adopted in 1639 and became the first written constitution in the North American colonies.
___ was an outspoken supporter of religious freedom in the Massachusetts Bay colony that was banished due to her beliefs. She fled to the colony of Rhode Island.
René Robert Cavelier, Sieur de la Salle was a ___ explorer that tried to establish a colony along the Mississippi River, but actually landed at Matagorda.
Colonies such as ___, Rhode Island, and New Hampshire mainly focused on economic activities such as ship building and trade.
In a ___ country, the government owns most industries and businesses and there is little to no private ownership.
The above excerpt from the Mayflower Compact states that the document was signed at ___. ("In witness whereof we have hereunto subscribed our names at...")
The ___ government became more interested in creating settlements in Texas to keep the French from establishing control of the region.
The Charter of Massachusetts specifically calls for the creation of the offices of ___.
___ were colonial military settlements used by the Spanish to defend the territory they claimed from Native populations.
The Charter of Massachusetts Bay was authorized by the King of England, ___.
Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and Iran are all examples of unlimited governments in ___.
The current Chief Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court is ___.
The Virginia House of Burgesses held its first session as a representative part of the colonial government in ___.
According to The Instructions for the Virginia Company, the chief way to prosper and have success was ___.
option_a: to drill troops regularly and intensely
option_b: to all work together for the good of the country
option_c: to work in the fields every day without fail
option_d: to find gold or other precious metals
correct_answer: to all work together for the good of the country

question: A socialist economic system generally provides a wide variety of services to its citizens, but also features ___ than a free enterprise system.
The Mayflower Compact states that the Mayflower was sent in order to plant the first colony in ___.
Nearly all ___ nations have featured limited governments for decades.

A(n) ___ has elected leaders that act on behalf of the citizens.
When ___ is in short supply in an economy, it can result in migration, outsourcing, and even enslavement.
Respecting the rights of others, being informed about needs of the community, and staying informed about the actions of elected leaders are all examples of ___.
The Instructions for the Virginia Company required that carpenters and skilled builders first construct a ___ before any private structures.
Fishing was most essential to the economy of the ___ British colonies in North America.
The will of the majority and a focus on the good of the settlement were principles of the ___ written in 1620.
All of the above items describe ___ colonies in North America. (Had many settlements in Canada, Sent Jesuit Missionaries, Used St. Lawrence River, Focused on fur trade)
The amounts of entrepreneurs and foreign capital were limited in ___ prior to the 1990s, which limited the ability of its economy to grow.
The Maryland Act of Toleration was the first law in the North American colonies requiring ___.
option_a: all men be allowed to vote

question: All of the following are major characteristics of the free enterprise system in the United States EXCEPT for ___.
A country that has a limited supply of natural resources may develop a(n) ___ which is an economy based almost entirely on a single crop.

On June 19, 1865, enslaved people in Texas were informed about the Emancipation Proclamation when General Gordon Granger announced the end of slavery and the Civil War in ___.
The Massachusetts Bay Colony established in ___ was a charter colony.
___ is the Majority Leader of the United States Senate.
All of the following were mentioned as the three main types of jobs assigned by The Instructions for the Virginia Company EXCEPT for ___?
Leaders of the Texas independence movement first officially announced their separation from Mexico at ___.
The desire for financial gain that acts as an incentive in the free enterprise system is known as ___.
The first permanent European settlement in, what is now, the United States was ___. It was founded by Spain in 1565.
All of the following examples in the diagram above belong in the box EXCEPT for ___. (Influence of the Spanish Government in Colonial Texas)
___ is an essential characteristic of the free enterprise economic system. It is a transaction where consumers and producers trade goods and services freely.
In 1608, ___ Pierre de Mons and Samuel de Champlain founded the first permanent settlement in the St. Lawrence Valley at Quebec City.
The above excerpt from The Instructions for the Virginia Company can best be completed by that statement that Natives should not be allowed to know ___. ("...Do not advertise...")
option_a: when members of the settlement have been killed or are sick
option_b: where the grain or harvest is stored
option_c: what other countries have established settlements
option_d: how the cannons or firearms work or are repaired
correct_answer: when members of the settlement have been killed or are sick

question: Francisco Coronado was a Spanish conquistador that explored the ___ and searched for the Seven Cities of Gold.
The factor of production most affected by drought and a lack of readily available water sources is/are ___.

Shipbuilding was most significant in the economy of the ___ colonies.
All of the following were motivations for the Spanish to explore and settle Texas EXCEPT for ___.
option_c: expanding the influence of the King

question: When ___ is/are in short supply in an economy it can result in a lack of development and the need for foreign involvement.

All the items listed above are best described as examples of ___. (Right to vote, Speak freely, Protest peacefully)
___ is the factor of production that is readily available in several Southwest Asian economies due to the sale of oil.
The settlement site recommended by The Instructions for the Virginia Company needed to be not too moist and also not too ___.
All of the following were listed as reasons needed for the creation of the Mayflower Compact EXCEPT for the need ___?
The ability to own property, change employment, or join a union are examples of ___ in a society with a representative government.
As of 2024, ___ served as the Attorney General of the United States.
According to the Charter, future governors and other officers of the Massachusetts Bay Company ___.
option_c: would be elected by members of the company
correct_answer: would be elected by members of the company

question: A free enterprise system requires competition in order to thrive, but the British government tried to limit that in its colonies by using a ___ system.
Free speech, right to property, and the ability to freely exercise a religion are all key components of societies with ___ governments.
As of 2024, ___ was the Secretary of State for the United States.

Crops such as indigo, rice, and sugar were mainly grown in the ___ colonies.
Another example of a limited government would be ___. (List includes: Australia, South Korea, Philippines)
As of 2024, the United States Senate Majority Leader was ___.
All of the following are examples of unlimited government systems EXCEPT for ___.
The ___ became an example of representative government that was imitated by many other British colonies as more were established in North America.
The first English settlement attempted in North America was founded in 1585 at ___ by Sir Walter Raleigh.
The Mayflower Compact states that the signers wanted to combine themselves into a ___ for a better chance at preservation and success in their goals.
Enslaved people in American colonies were mainly used in the production of ___.
The leadership positions created by The Massachusetts Bay Charter were able to create laws and rules for the colony as long as they were ___.
option_a: not in opposition to English laws
option_b: fair to all people of all backgrounds
correct_answer: not in opposition to English laws

question: China, Laos, and Vietnam are all examples of ___ governments.
An agreement among people in a group to cooperate for the benefits of the community is known as a ___.
One of the main reasons that the ___ tried to establish colonies in North and South America was to spread the influence of Catholicism.
An example of the ___ spirit of colonists in North America was their development of cottage industries to produce goods and start businesses.
Wages in the United States under a free enterprise system are generally determined by ___.
